subject: Re: [junit] Class Cast Exception
msgSnippet: I believe the problem is not related to DOM4J, but your XML parser in your classpath (or in this case no XML parser class being found). My guess is you are not

I believe the problem is not related to DOM4J, but your XML parser in 
your classpath (or in this case no XML parser class being found).

My guess is you are not explicitly setting your parser in your 
classpath.  You need to make sure that you are using the same JVM in 
your development and test environments if you are relying on the JAXP 
mechanism.

JDK 1.4 and up have a built in XML parser that DOM4J will automatically 
find for you via JAXP.  But the code snippet you showed has nothing to 
to do with DOM4J.  It is an XML parser class.  Take a look at Xerces or 
Crimson.

I would look closely at my classpath and be explicit on the XML parser.

Hope that helps.

Later,
Dave
